meanings.definition: A fit of rage or hysterics.
meanings.sent1: She had conniptions when she found out her favorite toy was missing.
meanings.sent2: The toddler threw conniptions when he couldn't have any more candy.
meanings.sent3: The cat's conniptions over a laser pointer never failed to entertain the family.
meanings.sent4: His conniptions over losing the game were like a storm brewing inside him.
meanings.sent5: The conniptions she had over a small mistake were completely out of proportion.

meanings.definition: A state of extreme agitation or excitement.
meanings.sent1: The conniptions in the crowd grew as the concert start time approached.
meanings.sent2: She was in conniptions waiting for the results of her exam.
meanings.sent3: The conniptions of the puppy when it saw its owner after a long day were heartwarming.
meanings.sent4: The conniptions of the storm made the trees sway violently in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The conniptions of the fans reached a fever pitch as their team scored the winning goal.
